meanings.definition: A person or animal closely acquainted with or related to someone.
meanings.sent1: My dog is one of my familiars, always by my side.
meanings.sent2: The cat, a familiar of the old man, followed him everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The parrot, a familiar of the family, mimicked their laughter.
meanings.sent4: The horse, a familiar of the farm, knew every corner of the fields.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel, a familiar of the park, greeted visitors with curiosity.

meanings.definition: A spirit often embodied in an animal and held to attend and serve or guard a person.
meanings.sent1: Legends speak of familiars protecting their owners from harm.
meanings.sent2: The black cat was believed to be the witch's familiar.
meanings.sent3: The ghostly familiar of the castle scared away intruders with its howls.
meanings.sent4: The owl, a familiar of the forest, watched over the lost travelers.
meanings.sent5: The wolf, a familiar of the mountains, guided the weary hiker to safety.

meanings.definition: A demon supposedly attending and obeying a witch, often said to assume the form of an animal.
meanings.sent1: In folklore, familiars aided witches in their magical practices.
meanings.sent2: The toad, a familiar of the sorceress, carried out her dark bidding.
meanings.sent3: The bat, a familiar of the enchantress, flew through the night on secret missions.
meanings.sent4: The snake, a familiar of the warlock, slithered silently in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The raven, a familiar of the wizard, delivered messages across realms.
